a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Fertility rate vs. share living in extreme poverty, 2023
The total fertility rate, in a given year. Extreme poverty is defined as living below the International Poverty Line of
Data source: UN, World Population Prospects (2024); World Bank Poverty and Inequality Platform (2024)
Note: Poverty data is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices to account for inflation and differences in the cost of living between
countries. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, per capita.
